title: abu
notes: abu is one of a handful of nouns ending in -u.

title: ad
defList: (post., inanimate only) have: X Y ad = Y has X
(adverb) about to, going to, (forms near future aspect)

title: afêkz
notes: Unlike English, this is not used with subordinate clauses, including reporting knowledge of experiences - evidentials are used for that instead. In addition, bakaz is telic and dynamic, while afêkz is atelic and stative.

title: afêssaur
etym: afêst 'shortsword' + saurz 'watch' construed as a 1st class noun

title: akku
notes: See bo for the standard instrumental

title: arama
etym: Proto-Eremo-Numoran *xere-ma 'copper' from *xere 'fire' + *ma 'bearer, holder, container'. Compare Modern Eremoran dare 'gold', ardo 'fire', and mat 'house'.

title: arlire
etym: Proto-Eremo-Numoran *erelire 'deciduous tree', from *ereu 'red' + *lire 'wood'. cf. lilira, talira.

title: astedu
notes: Cf. uzurkelau.

title: azmu
notes: azmu is one of a handful of nouns ending in -u.

title: bakaz
notes: Unlike English, this is not used with subordinate clauses, including reporting knowledge of experiences - evidentials are used for that instead. cf. bakaz, a similar meaning with opposite transitivity. In addition, bakaz is telic and dynamic, while afêkz is atelic and stative.

title: baliz
notes: X trades Y for Z's A - X dir Y ad A Z ad baliz

title: balitz
notes: Note: With causative, means kill.

title: ban
defList: (negative) hardly, barely, not at all, not even

title: bat
notes: n., 3rd

title: be
notes: see id and nanau for ors linking nominals

title: bidzam
etym: Loan from Važcud binž 'small' with 5th class nominalization as *bidʒam

title: bilu
notes: bilu is one of a handful of nouns ending in -u.

title: bo
notes: see ku for the comitative

title: bokusam
defList:
a large quantity, many
  • morMOR iI bokusamBOKUSAM
  • There are many people.
notes: cf. udou, the adjective form, and pukusam, the opposite form

title: breka
notes: Synonym: dirabeka

title: busk
defList: an owned dog (specifically, one that is not feral or stray)
notes: Feral/stray dogs are called lusik 'wolf'

title: da
notes: This does not translate country or nation in all English uses. When referring to an ethnos, use mor instead.

title: dalu
defList: (of the sky) having moderate cloud cover

title: dammam
defList: ereyesterday, the day before yesterday, two days ago

title: dantam
defList: overmorrow, the day after tomorrow, two days hence

title: dasu
notes: adj.

title: defôz
defList: [particle assuring the listener of what has been said]

title: din
defList: ~ give/take*: X i Y ad Z din = Z gives X to Y
(informal, ardo i +) ~ love*: Y ad Z din = Y loves Z
notes: Note: * - There are many possible arrangements of this phrase. To emphasize the recipient, ad may even be replaced by dir. The most neutral phrasing is shown. ZE dialects use this prepositionally for translative senses.

title: dinkalz
defList: ask for guidance, help, aid, etc

title: dinrôz
notes: In the sense of "mean", what is the direct object in English would be construed with lative ad "to".

title: dir
etym: 1st class ending of Old Eremoran *diu [polite affix] (nowadays replaced by ou), Proto-Eremo-Numoran *diu, reanalyzed as a preposition.

title: dirabeka
notes: Synonym: breka

title: dô
notes: ZE dialects use this prepositionally for translative senses.

title: dôkaz
etym: Altered form of adafkaz, from ad 'to' + afkaz 'go'
notes: Replaced the now-obsolete kunz.

title: dômo
notes: Always sentence-initial

title: dou
notes: cf. pukusam, the noun form

title: edzam
defList: a unit of measurement equal to one-quarter of one labnim (~42.6 mm)

title: empra
etym: Pre-Eremoran ēmperā evidently loaned from Važcud imphera "lemon", with numerous descendants, being a well-travelled wanderwort.

title: erem
notes: Note: used with tar (tar seerem) and muk (muk seerem) for dawn and dusk, respectively.

title: habiz
defList: live (vivere, non habitare, quid est ~ dô momtantan)

title: hafa
etym: Proto-Eremo-Numoran *ɸexɸex 'rain', reduplicated from *ɸex [onomatopoeia for falling rain]

title: hakz
notes: v.

title: hans
defList:
and*
  • Roraok su lusik su dir hans kopdoz.
    cat GEN dog GEN ABS all love-DIM
    I like both cats and dogs.
notes: Due to historical reasons, this word has an irregular spelling; *hanz would be expected. There also exist the rare conjunctions unau 'nor', ufans 'nand', and unanau 'xnor', generally only used in formal writing

title: hanum
defList:
(noun + su +) [used to indicate an outcome effected with the hands]; by hand, ahold
  • Sazam i afêst su dir hanum zestisudôz ômôrz.
    awe TOP shortsword GEN ABS hold bent-CAUS EXP.PL
    We were amazed to see him bend the shortsword by hand.

title: hekz
notes: See zurkrôz

title: ho
defList: that, those (away from speaker and listener)

title: hoki
etym: reduced from hókio, from ho + kiom

title: i
notes: Used to make have/give constructions like ad when the possessor is animate

title: id
defList:
or (exclusive)*
  • Roraok su lusik su dir id kopdoz.
    cat GEN dog GEN ABS or love.DIM
    I like either cats or dogs.

(ko +) the same individual, the thing just mentioned: (cf. "se" in Latin, proximate pronoun)
  • Mor i lulz ku, kor id i libaz.
    person TOP laugh and, "the same person" TOP cry
    The person laughed, and then they [same person] cried.

(hoki/ho +) the other individual, the other thing recently mentioned: (cf. obviative pronoun)
  • Mor i lulz ku, hor id i libaz.
    person TOP laugh and, "the other person" TOP cry
    The person laughed, and then they [another person] cried.
(+ plural det) considering each member of the determiner equally, eg. id hans = "every" specifically rather than all. (Distributive pronoun/determiner)
notes: See be for an or linking clauses. cf. nanau, inclusive or and "quelque" some. The choice of hoki vs. ho with the obviative mostly has to do with whether the person is close in relation or proximity to the listener

title: irerz
notes: used of the final product, NOT ingredients - cf. en. brew - used esp. of tea

title: irikar
etym: derived from the proper noun Irikar, a people in the near part of the western mountains who are stereotyped to be hoaxsters.

title: it
notes: adv.

title: kaldoz
notes: Unlike English, this verb is not catenative, and only takes nouns as direct objects. To express wanna, one would use the optative.

title: kamit
defList: any drink brewed with hot water except tea (from Camellia sinensis), including herbal teas and coffee

title: kaskru
notes: kaskru is one of a handful of nouns ending in -u.

title: kasu
notes: kasu is one of a handful of nouns ending in -u.

title: kôbensu
notes: cf. en. mousy and la. murinus, mirroring senses 3-5.

title: kotaz
notes: Note: this verb forms many compounds. (TODO; Will add soon!)

title: ku
notes: See bo for the instrumental. See hans for an and linking nominals.

title: kubatu
notes: see batu for the verbal "too"

title: kudam
defList: (proscribed) Kudom, the third of three seasons of the Eremoran calendar

title: kudom
defList: The third of three seasons of the Eremoran calendar

title: kudôz
notes: <sup>1</sup> Habitual aspect only

title: kusan
etym: conflation of kusam nem and kusam

title: laku
notes: Displaced by synonym uzurku after laku became sarcastic

title: lilira
etym: reduplicated from Proto-Eremo-Numoran *lire 'wood'. cf. arlira, talira.

title: lusik
notes: Owned dogs are called busk

title: malbnur
etym: loan from a northern language, cf. Poltas

title: mat
etym: Proto-Eremo-Numoran *ma-t, from *ma 'bearer, holder, container' + *-t (suffix for tools)

title: mekrak
etym: Pre-Eremoran mēkara, loaned from Nuzdexax megaraxu, from Važcud meguarakhu "tingle-worm"
defList: a parastitic flatworm used primarily in torture and occasionally medicinally for its behavior-altering effects

title: mid
defList: in one's possession, on one's person

title: minibak
notes: Note: despite being animate, this refers to unfertilized eggs, too.

title: mo
notes: n., 4th

title: mor
notes: This does not translate country or nation in all English uses. When referring to territory, use da instead.

title: morôz
defList: [Specifies the speaker heard of the event mentioned]

title: mu
notes: mu is one of a handful of nouns ending in -u.

title: musu
notes: not humid

title: na
notes: Modern Eremoran uses nau, which was originally just the determiner form.

title: nanau
defList:
or (inclusive)*
  • Roraok su lusik su dir nanau kopdoz.
    cat GEN dog GEN ABS or love.DIM
    I like either cats or dogs.
notes: See be for the verbal conjunction. cf. id.

title: nask
notes: Note: this word does not refer to carnivores in general, only carnivorans.

title: nasu
defList: (+ plural det) considering each member of the determiner in pairs, eg. nasu hans = "every pair" specifically rather than all. (Distributive pronoun/determiner)
notes: While possible with greater numerals, it is rather rare.

title: nes
notes: Typically refers to where the speaker usually sleeps, often a bedroom.

title: nub
notes: Due to historical reasons, this word has an irregular spelling; *nu would be expected.

title: ô
defList: Anyways..., so... (used similarly to jp. ja, fr. alors)

title: ok
etym: Eye-dialect spelling of holk in L-dropping dialects
notes: The k is occasionally pronounced as a glottal stop.

title: omor
notes: see Pronouns for more details

title: ômôrz
defList: [Specifies the speaker, and others, saw the event mentioned]
notes: cf. umôrz which implies the speaker was the sole witness

title: ou
etym: Old Eremoran *ɸo- [polite prefix], from Pre-Eremoran *po- [polite prefix]
defList: [affix used to form first/second person personal pronouns, eg. môk]

title: pi
defList: onomatopoeia for something sparkly or shiny

title: pidzak
etym: Old Eremoran pītsa "sheep", from Pre-Eremoran pʰīdʒa, evidently loaned from Važcud phijas.

title: pukusam
defList:
a small quantity, few
  • morMOR iI pukusamPUKUSAM
  • There are few people.
notes: cf. dou, the adjective form, and bokusam, the opposite form

title: raratit
defList: meat (in general, including flesh and fish)

title: razbakum
etym: from Pre-Eremoran resepakup, evidently loaned from Važcud zesepakubu "tilelaying", from zese "tile" + paku "lay; lie". Present form influenced by raz 'paint'.
notes: esp. of interior wall painting patterns

title: reram
defList: The second of three seasons of the Eremoran calendar

title: roraok
notes: Perhaps due to a combination of its reduplication, and the unusual form of the interjection, the spelling is irregular from what might be expected (*raraok).

title: roradok
etym: Syncopated from roraodok, from Proto-Eremo-Numoran *raoraodox 'kitten', diminutive of *raoraox 'cat'

title: rôraz
defList: (+dir tikt ad X) hone X (a skill or weapon)

title: rôz
notes: Unlike English, the direct object is the person being spoken to/with, and the content being spoken is construed with bo "with; using".

title: ruskank
defList: a zothceng, a large, semi-intelligent symbiotic fungus-beehive beast

title: sarm
defList: unit of area equivalent to 50 square labnim, or about 1.452 m<sup>2</sup>

title: sart
defList: mat, typically in the dimensions of 5-by-10 labnim

title: sazaz
notes: Note: with causative, means "scare".

title: se
defList: a unit of measurement equal to one-fifteenth of one edzam (~2.84 mm)

title: sedam
defList: unit of area about 3,100 m^2 or 0.76 acres

title: ses
defList:
substellar object orbiting a star
  1. (by extension) planet
  2. (by extension) minor planet
  3. (by extension) comet

title: sisikruêr
notes: In Eremoran times, these two roles are functioned by the same person

title: sisikrum
notes: In Eremoran times, these two roles are functioned by the same person

title: siu
defList: (of the sky) overcast, but not with stormclouds (which would be usiu; cf. perlucidus and translucidus)

title: siz
notes: v.

title: skôkiz
notes: With the causative suffix, means 'hurl' or 'send'.

title: stanu
notes: stanu is one of a handful of nouns ending in -u.

title: stum
defList: The first of three seasons of the Eremoran calendar

title: su
etym: Proto-Eremo-Numoran *tʃu 'of; from'. Related to the suffix -(i)su.
defList: of; belonging to or made of

title: subanbanz
notes: note: implies other people were present who also experienced something

title: sudôz
defList: (animate subject and object) fuck; have sex with
(animate subject, inanimate object, of a consumable1) enjoy
(inanimate subject, human object) be a cause of termination for
notes: <sup>1</sup> Habitual aspect only

title: talire
etym: Proto-Eremo-Numoran *talire 'evergreen', from older *taslire, from *tassu 'green' + *lire 'wood'. Related to taze, tasu, tasku. cf. arlira, lilira.

title: tasku
etym: tasu 'green' + skum 'winter'. Related to talira, taze, and tasu.
notes: tasusku is one of a handful of nouns ending in -u.

title: tasu
etym: Proto-Eremo-Numoran *tassu 'green', from *tase 'grass' + *-su '-ish'. Related to talira, taze, and tasusku.

title: taze
etym: Proto-Eremo-Numoran *tase 'grass'. Related to talira, tasu, and tasusku.

title: taze dô kadôl
defList: someone or something that stands out among the crowd in some positive aspect, especially beauty

title: tekkat
notes: The color adjectives kanut (yellow), siut (white), and tasut (green) can be applied to tekkat with an identical meaning to English. However, ulut (blue/black) is used to refer to oolong, and eret (red) is used to refer to black tea, likely in reference to the color of the leaves. It is also important to note that usiut (black/dark) cannot be used interchangably with ulut; the former refers instead to fermented tea instead of oolong.

title: tranzu
notes: Irregular. Expected form *tranu unattested.

title: tum
defList: set of objects visible overhead from a reference point

title: udou
defList:
(with id) (the) most (incl. superlative)
  • Roraok i id -udou kopdoz.
    cat TOP most like
    I like cats the most.
notes: cf. bokusam, the noun form

title: ulu
notes: For black specifically, see usiu

title: umôrz
defList: [Specifies the speaker, but not others, saw the event mentioned]
notes: cf. ômôrz which implies others witnessed the event too

title: upiam
etym: Pre-Eremoran uppayāpa "rune; glyph; symbol", evidently loaned from Važcud pagubu "writing", nominalization of pagu "write".

title: ur
defList: therefore, thus, so, for this/that reason

title: usiu
defList: (of the sky) overcast with storm clouds; having heavy cloud cover

title: utôzmu
defList: darn, dang, oh well, how unfortunate

title: zurkrôz
notes: See hekz
